title: What the lore-power curve feels like right now.
body:
>Early 2015

Welcome to the League champion spotlight, featuring Bard. Bard is a celestial caretaker who only intervenes when necessary with cosmic power and unstoppable magical force.

>Mid 2015

This is Kindred. The aspect of death itself, Kindred is a literal force of nature and bows to no mortal. Oh. There's also Tahm Kench, who's a demon that can do whatever he needs through demon magic and eating.

>Late 2015

Welcome to the Illaoi Spotlight. Illaoi drags a god along to the rift to smite people. She beats people to death by tearing out their souls.

>Early 2016

Behold Aurelion Sol. He's a universe-sized dragon who conjures stars and suns and stuff then destroys them. He's essentially Galactus if Galactus was scaly and voiced by Cucumber Bandersnatch

>Mid 2016

Welcome to the League of Legends champion spotlight. Featuring God, the God. God is God and can't be stopped. 

>Late 2016

Champion Reveal: Rioter, the guy who programmed God into the game and can actually unprogram god out of existence. 

>Early 2017

We're proud to announce Rioter's Boss, the guy who will fire Rioter and has way more power than him.

I know you guys are flexing your muscles but does anyone else feel lore power creep is getting kinda....huge?

replies.body:
> Mid 2017

The teaser video starts... there's a low beat, powerful, intimidating.  

Exterior - we are high hiiiigh above the planet Runeterra (freeze-frame for cloud-wreathed map of the world; Boards go mental, Bio sighs in relief).  A crackling of incredible power accompanies the introduction of discordant strings.  A portal shimmers once, twice, and then EXPLODES open in the vacuum above the planet.  String crescendo!

Zoom into the hazy portal.  Interior - a bedroom (much like the one in the [Warriors 2014 music video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fmI_Ndrxy14)) illuminated by the 'Victory' screen.  A shadowy silhouette is backlit by the glowing monitor - we cannot tell details, but it is human.  Zoom to the screen.  The cursor, accompanied by the increasingly intense drum beat, moves with uncanny speed to the X button in the top right of the window.

And _clicks_.

The music abruptly changes - the ominous strings have returned, quieter now and magical.  The lighting in the room is different - the screen is black (artistic license).  Birds tweet outside and we think dawn might be breaking.

The figure turns to us, slowly, confidently.  Too dark in the shadows to see, their eyes nonetheless glint as we fade to black.

**Introducing: The Player.**  Without which, there is no game.  The _ultimate_ power.

Game Over.

Late 2017: We created a monster allowing the player to be released. Toxicity has increased above any expected level, threatening to destroy the game and the world.

Hopefully our new champion is powerful enough to deal with this. Today we're pleased to introduce... Morgan Freeman:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ch5MEJk5ZCQ

Morgan Freeman

"Why yes, this is me talking. And this is you, reading this in my voice. You can't do anything else, can you? That's how amazing and sexy my voice is. In fact, all sounds effects for this game will now be replaced with random lines from me. Enjoy."
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J8mTwCRZLWA

Late 2017:

The Player came out of the basement to get something to eat. Suddenly the door next to the basement door opens and The Player is exposed to sunlight. He turns to sand.

The End.

**Introducing: The Scripter**, this is the reworked version of the player. Due to how complicated the kits of the champions became, every player is now scripting, so, we found it appropriate to introduce a lore update and rework for **The Player**.


Even later:
Since **The Scripter** release date, our game popularity sky rocketed. And even more, the game's hot hours started to be found even during night time. Sadly, many players also complain that **The Player** is gone, as such we are introducing a new champion for everyone's melancholy.

**Behold, THE MOM**. Its **The Player**'s Mom as well as **The Scripter**'s Mom. She is so strong, that she doesn't even allow the to play the game during night time. This is a force beyond force, its life itself and the strongest being in our universe.

Eh, while, creating and destroying a star really does blow the power of everyone else out of proportion. But myths, legends, and stories have been about seemingly weaker guys finding a way to beat those that should be way stronger than them from time immemorial.  From Herakles defeating the giants to save Olympus, David taking down Goliath, a random knight named George who takes down a dragon.  

That there are creatures that seem to have great power is not in itself a problem, so long as they can theoretically be beaten by a guy with a shotgun you're fine.  

Of course, saying that a shotgun can take down a guy who is infused with power like say, Nasus, is fine.  His power is fairly vague. But when we actually see someone destroy a star, yeah, killing that with a shotgun seems less and less believable.

Kindred is death and cannot die, if that translated into gameplay at all they would be impossible to balance and win every game. (just one example out of many, many examples). Having Summoners to "contain and control" these beings of immense power was a cool bit of narrative, sure, but it was also extremely limiting and boring.

I'm not happy with lore as it is now, I find it laughable and don't believe Riot will be able to fix the mess they've made anytime soon. It is what it is *shrugs*
It was only limiting when the writers didn't bother to expand on it though.

"It is limiting" is one of the laziest excuses for "We don't want to bother anymore." And it is equally frustrating and saddening, that so many people gobble that excuse up.

Yes, it creates limits for your ideas but that is part of the profession: To adhere to your setting and find ways to make your ideas, your desired outcomes work in that setting. The Institute may have been "hindering" to Riot's writing staff to do whatever the fuck they want, but that limitation forced them to create characters with certain stories and connections in the world.

And we see the consequences of the appraised, rampant "creative freedom" in the champs and rewrites of old champs. Sure, there's the occasional champion with actual character but more than ever we find one-note champs with nothing to them. Gnar is just an ancient yordle. Rek'sai is just some beast. Ekko is just some boy, with a machine that's way more interesting than himself and about which he knows little to nothing about. Jinx is just some insane bitch who is in no way as old as Riot claims her to be. Kalista is some spirit with really weird working ethics. Tristana became just some yordle with a gun, etc., etc.

"Creative Freedom" sounds good on paper until it is used as a plain cover for "barely trying anymore".

I say this because Illaoi is still mortal and uses spiritualism to fight off undead spirits.  Her strength is powerful enough to fight her designated enemy, but in a head to head fight with Leona (hell Bard would just turn her in another direction), I don't think she'll be able to win.
